entry.def: If something happens suddenly, it happens quickly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: Suddenly, she looked ten years older...
example.tran: 突然间她看起来老了 10 岁。

Sentence.sentence: A few years later, a large defense buildup finally provided a fiscal stimulus adequate to the economy's needs—and suddenly industry was eager to employ those unadaptable and untrained workers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: If scholars suddenly discovered that Rembrandt had dashed off "The Night Watch" in an afternoon, it would still be "The Night Watch.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In 1920 he went to teach in New York and died there suddenly after only three weeks.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: A few years later, a large defense buildup finally provided a fiscal stimulus adequate to the economy's needs—and suddenly industry was eager to employ those "unadaptable and untrained" workers.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Because it's such a pity if you start off on a bright tone on a story and suddenly realize you are talking about some people having been killed in a road crash.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: But after General mills bought Epic in 2016, Collins and Forrest suddenly had the resources they needed to expand their supply chain.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: It's just that suddenly at university you are expected to behave like an adult.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Remember how you feel when you are speeding down the highway and a big truck suddenly brakes twenty meters in front of you.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

sentences.sentence: "suddenly she felt a sharp pain in her side"
"he decided to go to Chicago on the spur of the moment"

Sentence.sentence: After less than a week, I started noticing that the groceries were running out pretty quickly — we were always suddenly out of something.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 语法填空 A 原文

Sentence.sentence: An hour later, I woke up suddenly with the solution clearly in mind.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: As the ceremony was nearing the end, I suddenly heard the head coach announcing, "the highest honor goes to Cathy!" looking around, he continued, "Cathy has inspired us with her will and enthusiasm."
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I suddenly found myself out of class before noon time.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I suddenly realized something: I had read a book, and I had loved reading that book.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: I was driving down to London when I suddenly found that I was on the wrong road.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: In the quietness of my bedroom, the story suddenly all came clear to me.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: It enables small-scale farmers to harvest 175 pounds of green vegetables per hour—a huge improvement over harvesting just a few dozen pounds by hand—suddenly making it possible for the little guys to compete with large farms of California.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: She pushed her way to the driver and took the suitcase thankfully, everyone on the bus began talking about what the boy had done, and the crowd of strangers suddenly became friendly to one another.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Suddenly another thought went through kate's mind like an electric shock.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（10月） 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Suddenly I sensed a man standing behind me.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Suddenly, he saw a car with its bright lights on.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷1 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Suddenly, Paris fell to the ground, "Paris's eye rolled back, " Taylor says.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The sense of excitement and tension levels rise suddenly though, as does your heart rate, as you move closer to them.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Therefore, when a person from one of these cultures is speaking and suddenly stops, what Maybe implied is that the person wants the listener to consider what has been said before continuing.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Now the company is suddenly claiming that the 2002 agreement is invalid because of the 2006 legislation, and that only the federal government has regulatory power over nuclear issues.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Suddenly, Britain looks to have fallen out with its favourite historical form.
Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: We suddenly can't remember where we put the keys just a moment ago, or an old acquaintance's name, or the name of an old band we used to love.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: When there is rapid improvement in the price and performance of technology, jobs that were once thought to be immune from automation suddenly become threatened.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: Mary suddenly appeared in the doorway.
sentences.cn: 玛丽突然出现在门口。

sentences.en: My heart suddenly began beating violently.
sentences.cn: 我的心突然开始猛烈地跳动。

sentences.en: My mind suddenly switched back to my conversation with Jeremy.
sentences.cn: 我的思绪突然回到了与杰里米的谈话上。

sentences.en: I suddenly remembered that I hadn’t locked the door.
sentences.cn: 我突然记起我没有锁门。
“你听！”多伊尔突然说。
sentences.en: ‘Listen! ’ said Doyle suddenly.

sentences.cn: 我突然明白我该怎么做了。
sentences.en: I suddenly realized what I had to do.

sentences.cn: 一切都来得那么突然。
sentences.en: It all happened so suddenly.

sentences.cn: 突然间她看起来老了 10 岁。
sentences.en: Suddenly, she looked ten years older...

sentences.cn: 她的表情一下子变了。
sentences.en: Her expression suddenly altered...

sentences.cn: 这个计划会实施 吗 ?
sentences.en: Will this plan be put into practice?

sentences.cn: “她干吗要批评我呢?”他想到这里豁然开朗,心情也舒展了.
sentences.en: Why should she have criticized him , he wondered. Then he suddenly saw the light and began to feel relieved.

sentences.cn: 玛丽突然出现在门口.
sentences.en: Mary suddenly appeared in the doorway.

sentences.cn: 启航四天后, 泰坦尼克号在穿过北大西洋多冰的海域时, 瞭望员突然发现了一个巨大的冰山.
sentences.en: Four days after setting out , while the Titantic was sailing across the icy waters of the North Atlantic, a huge iceberg was suddenly spotted by a lookout.

sentences.cn: 最安全的办法是在后面保持相当一段距离,以防前面的汽车突然停车.
sentences.en: It's safest to keep a good distance behind in case the car in front suddenly stops.

sentences.cn: 宝拉皱了皱眉头, 突然警惕起来.
sentences.en: Paula frowned, suddenly wary.

sentences.cn: 她看起来是客客气气的,一旦脾气发作起来,就张牙露齿不那么客气了.
sentences.en: She had always seemed friendly until suddenly she began to show her teeth.

sentences.cn: 他忽闻有人在牡丹亭畔长吁短叹.
sentences.en: Suddenly he heard a rustle in the peony pavilion and someone sighing deeply.

sentences.cn: 我忽然想到一个主意.
sentences.en: An idea suddenly struck me.

sentences.cn: 他脚下的土地突然陷下去了.
sentences.en: The ground suddenly sank under his feet.

sentences.cn: 她出发向大街跑去,但是突然掉头向屋子跑去.
sentences.en: She started running towards the street but suddenly doubled back to the house.

sentences.cn: 突然杰克大喊他丢失了五英镑.
sentences.en: Suddenly Jack shouted that he had lost five pounds.

sentences.cn: 他突然叫道仓库着火了.
sentences.en: He suddenly cried out that the storehouse was on fire.

sentences.cn: 人群突然涌进商店.
sentences.en: The crowd suddenly poured into the store.

sentences.cn: 他突然被探照灯照中而暴露无遗.
sentences.en: He was suddenly caught in the full beam of a searchlight.

sentences.cn: 过了一会儿,她突然苏醒过来.
sentences.en: In a few moments she suddenly came to.

sentences.cn: 玻璃窗上突然露出一张面孔.
sentences.en: Suddenly a face appeared at the window.

sentences.cn: 始而不解, 继而恍然.
sentences.en: At first I didn't catch on, then I suddenly saw the light.

sentences.cn: 天气突然冷了起来.
sentences.en: The weather suddenly turned cold.

sentences.cn: 大地突然裂开,形成一道深坑.
sentences.en: Suddenly a huge chasm opened in the earth.

sentences.cn: 下午天突然下雨了.
sentences.en: In the afternoon it rained suddenly.

sentences.cn: ”我突然想到了一个主意 “ 为什么不请马克大叔帮忙 呢 ?”
sentences.en: Suddenly an idea rushed into my head, " Why not ask Uncle Mark for help?

sentences.cn: 他突然不再像往常一样开玩笑.
sentences.en: He suddenly dropped his habitual banter.

sentences.cn: 那男子突然掏出手枪威胁司机.
sentences.en: Suddenly the man brought a gun out and threatened the driver with it.

sentences.cn: 你会发现,终有一天,所有这些有趣的事情突然意外地消失了.
sentences.en: You may find that one day those pleasant things suddenly and unexpectedly disappear.

sentences.cn: 乌龟顿时失去了控制, 竟意外地落在了兔子的后背上.
sentences.en: Turtle suddenly lost control, he accidentally fell on the back of the rabbit.

sentences.cn: 泰勒先生出乎意外地找到这份工作时,他身上的钱已所剩无几了.
sentences.en: Mr Taylor was down to his bottom dollar when he suddenly got the job.

sentences.cn: 你的影子忽然地又在我的脸上爬.唤醒沉睡多时的记忆.
sentences.en: The image of you suddenly climbs over my face again, awakening fast asleep old memories.

sentences.cn: 手电筒霍然一亮.
sentences.en: Suddenly somebody flashed an electric torch.

Sentence.sentence: But just before he reached the car door, he suddenly stopped, crouching ( ' ,  蹲伏 ) down to peer at something on the sidewalk.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Meetings at resorts are suddenly unacceptable.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: when nearly one-quarter of the workforce was unemployed, the divorce rate had declined by around 25% from 1929 But this doesn't mean people were suddenly happier with their marriages.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Born the 16th child to poor parents in Paris in either 1783 or 1784, a young Careme was suddenly abandoned at the height of the French Revolution.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: But just before he reached the car door, he suddenly stopped, crouching (蹲伏) down to peer at something on the sidewalk.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Suddenly, our market has exploded in size and we could now sell our products all across the continent.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section B
